intro: Maba abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian maba, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Maba abyssinica is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing benefits. Its conservation status is threatened due to habitat loss and overharvesting.
